text: hundreds of soldiers recovering at the
Juba military hospital one dead but
lucky to be alive these men some of the
first survivors of the ongoing conflict
many of them hit by bullets when the
fighting broke out everyday fresh
casualties arrived from far and wide
even civilians have come for help I was
shot in the leg she says I stayed in the
house for three days there was no one to
help me the beds are full but the doors
remain open there are a hundred and
thirty Ward beds here but more than a
thousand patients are currently admitted
we're overstressed we didn't have many
nurses and we didn't have many doctors
but all the same well they were we in
the work and children the ICRC came give
them a hand this hospital is the main
referral facility for the military here
in South Sudan it's continuing to
receive casualties from all over the
country which is why they are now this
tends to help ease of the pressure it's
already taking in more than ten times
its capacity
life is back on the streets of the
capital Juba the UN says it has started
patrols a dusk-to-dawn curfew is still
in force but the rebel controlled States
unity and jungly remain internally the
national government has declared a state
of emergency their South Sudanese are
hoping and praying for better days ahead
